FuncDef:
The dhcp client gateway-detect command enables gateway detection on a DHCP client.
The undo dhcp client gateway-detect command disables gateway detection on a DHCP client. The dhcp client gateway-detect command enables gateway detection on a DHCP client. The undo dhcp client gateway-detect command disables gateway detection on a DHCP client. By default, gateway detection is disabled on a DHCP client.
CLIs: dhcp client gateway-detect period <period> retransmit <retransmit> timeout <timeout>
ParentView: 100ge sub-interface view,100GE interface view,10GE sub-interface view,10GE interface view,200GE sub-interface view,200GE interface view,25GE sub-interface view,25GE interface view,400GE sub-interface view,400GE interface view,50GE sub-interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view,VBDIF interface view,VLANIF interface view,Management interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval for gateway detection on a DHCP client.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 86400 seconds.

Specifies the retransmission count of gateway detection on a DHCP client.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.

Specifies the timeout period of gateway detection on a DHCP client.
The value is an integer that ranges from 300 to 2000,the unit is milliseconds.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-100GE1/0/1] dhcp client gateway-detect period 3600 retransmit 3 timeout 500
ExtraInfo: The dhcp client gateway-detect command applies to DHCP clients. After a DHCP client obtains an IP address, the dhcp client gateway-detect command enables the DHCP client to detect the status of the gateway being used. If the gateway has an incorrect address or the gateway device fails, the DHCP client requests a new IP address from the DHCP server.
